result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward G. Henning was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payable at the rate of $150.00 per month, starting on or before April 1, 2016 and on the same day each month thereafter, until paid in full.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  $15.00 payment plan fee added.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward G. Henning

defendant.name: Henning, Edward G.
defendant.address: 909 Pierce Street, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Betthauser.  Amend Count 1 to misd, THC 1st.  Granted.  Defendant plead no contest to Counts 1 and 2.  Court advised the defendant of the possible penalties of the charges he is pleading to.  He understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of Counts 1 and 2.  Joint recommendation for $100 plus costs on each count.  Court ordered:  $100, plus costs each count.  Total $1,146.00.  Pay @ $150/mo starting 4/1/16.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Betthauser.  Set for plea/sentencing.

Pre-trial conference at 01-13-2016 10:00 am.
Status conference at 02-01-2016 03:00 pm.

Court questioned the defendant on his understanding of the waiver of time limits for holding the preliminary hearing.  Defendant stated he understood.  Court found defendant waived the time limit for holding the preliminary hearing.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.   Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Betthauser.   Reading of complaint waived.  Defendant stood mute. NGP entered by court on the misd charges..  PTC & STC dates set.  Bond continued.
From attorney Charles Betthauser requesting to reschedule the 12-7 initial.  Sent a copy to HZ.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

SPD William Poss appears specially with defendant preset.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Attorney Poss requests adjournment.  Court sets adjourned initial appearance for 12-7 at 9:30.  Address Ok.
